Key: ...Huh? What was I doing again?
...It's quiet. Are we in the middle of class?

...It's hard to walk. I feel a dull pain... Wait,
I seem to have grazed my knee.

I remember now! I tripped during P.E., so I'm on
my way to the infirmary. Uh, it's... this way.
What's the matter, Itsuka-kun?
Oh Tama-ch... I mean... Okamine-sensei.
I thought you were... in the middle of P.E. class.
Oh, I am. But I tripped.

What?! Listen to me, Itsuka-kun. Calm down.
First, let's check if you're conscious...

We're going to start from there?! I think you're
the one who needs to calm down! It's obvious
that I'm conscious.

I-It's my first time doing CPR, but... I promise,
um... I'll be gentle.

(She's breathing really heavily. Is that what
she's gearing up for?!)
Now then. Just relax, Itsuka-kun.

U-Uh, you're breathing out carbon dioxide, so I
don't need that. Sensei, please don't come any
closer.
No, this is very important.
Look, I just skinned my knee. See?
Oh, is that so? That's... unfortunate.
Are you serious?!

No wonder you're here. I thought you had turned
into a delinquent...

No, no... It's not like that, don't worry.
Anyways, I'll be going now, okay?
(Phew... That was a close one.)
Oh... Itsuka-kun. Hold on just a moment.

Huh? Y-Yes? Did you have something you wanted to
say?
Do you know Tobiichi-san in our class?
Tobiichi... You mean Origami Tobiichi?
Yes. I'm glad you remember her name.

Well, she sits next to me... And we've been
through some stuff together, kind of.

Oh, is that so? She hasn't been to class in a
while now...
Huh? Sh-She hasn't?

She's been coming to school, but going straight to
the infirmary. The seat next to you is always open
these days, you know.
Huh? Wait? Really?

Reaaally. Tobiichi-san hasn't come to class since
spring. Itsuka-kun, where did you see her last?

Oh... Is that so? Um... come to think of it,
maybe...
(Something feels off... I wonder what it is.)

(Maybe I'm imagining things. Tama-chan was the
one who brought it up, though.)

Tobiichi-san... She seems to not fit in with the
classroom. She's very quiet.
Quiet? Well, I guess she is...

I've been checking in on her from time to time.
If she's in the infirmary today, please send her
my regards.
U-Um... I will.
Thank you.
(Origami... Tobiichi.)

(I feel like I've heard her name before. I kind of
remember what she looks like...)

... Huh? Wait, I guess I can't remember her. Maybe
I just imagined it.
(Well, whatever. I'll head over to the infirmary.)
Excuse me.
(No one's here. What do I do?)

(Well, I'm sure no one will mind if I used some
alcohol and a bandage.)
Excuse me...
Oh?!
Whoa!
(A... girl?)

(I didn't notice because of the curtain. She
seemed to be frozen in shock. But she's in
uniform, so she's obviously a student here...)
Hahh...

(Man, she's really pretty. Wait... is she the
Tobiichi-san who always goes to the infirmary?)

(Hmmm. She seems familiar. I even feel like I've
spoken to her before.)

(Tama-chan did ask me to talk to her, so I guess
I'll approach her.)
Is the teacher not here?
Sorry for the wait.
D-Don't move. Put your hands up!

U-Um... is the teacher not in today? I tripped
during P.E.
U-Um... Um... Ahh?! I-I'm so sorry.
Huh?
(The girl blushed and ran away.)
(The air is tense. Maybe I should...)

Hey, sorry for the wait. Is there an opening on
the bed?
Huh...?! Ahh... I-I...

(Wait, did she think I was serious? She's frozen
stiff.)

Whoa... Um, sorry, that was a joke. A very
innocent joke.
...I'm going to go take a shower.
Okay, sure. Wait, huh? What?!
(She's going along with it?!)

(She's good at going along with things... But she
seemed serious.)

D-Don't move. Put your hands up! There's an
injured person here! Stay calm, and I won't pour
soy sauce into your curry!
(...Hey! What the hell am I saying?!)
H-Huh...?!
(She's still frozen.)
(M-Maybe I can treat myself now...)
(A-All right. I'm good now.)
U-Um...
Hm?
H-How long should I stay put like this?
Huh? Oh, sorry. I-I'm good now.

(She was still this whole time?
What a weird girl.)
I... I can move now?
Um, are you...
Huh? Hey!
S-Sorry...!
Oh...
Oh...
(I-I can see it...)

(No, no... Now isn't the time for that. Calm down,
Shido.)
Mmm...
A-Are you okay...?
No... Don't come near me.
Please don't phrase it like that. It sounds wrong.
If you come too close... I'll... get embarrassed.

(I see... so she's just shy. The teacher did say
she was quiet.)

Anyways, just calm down. I won't do anything. You
can get up on your own, right?
I just slipped... No problem.

I see. I'm glad. Then can you hurry up?
Or else, um...
Um, what?

Well the way you're positioned... I guess I'm
embarrassed to be facing you.
Oh...
Did you see it...?
Ye... I mean no. I didn't see it!
Really?

R-Really. So please get up. Uh, O-Origami
Tobiichi-san... right?
There was a name tag inside my skirt.
There was?! I don't remember seeing any letters...
So you did see it.
Oh... *grunt*... Crap...!
Pervert...

*Grunt*... S-Sorry! I'm going to close my eyes, so
please get up! I can't help but stare if you're
like that.
...It's fine. No need to close your eyes anymore.

*Sigh*... I'm glad. I'm going to open my eyes,
then.
Um... Are you hurt at all?
I-It's nothing...

I see. I'm glad. Uh, my name is Shido Itsuka. Nice
to meet you, Tobiichi-san.
...I know. I've always... been watching you.

I see. So you already know me, huh? Wait...
What do you mean you've always been watching
me? You're always in the infirmary, right?

I've seen you from far away with binoculars.
I remember you.
Oh, I see... Th-Thanks... I guess?
(...She's a weird one.)
(I wonder what this awkward silence is.)
Squirm...
Hm? What did you just say?
It's my way of expressing that I'm blushing.
Don't say it!
(She's not just shy. She's really weird.)
U-Um...
Y-Yeah. What's the matter?
Are you... okay? Your injury, I mean.

Oh, yeah, this isn't a big deal. I could just lick
it and it'd get better.
A-Are you going to... tell me to lick it...?
Huh?! No, no! That was just a saying.
A saying?

Um... I wanted to say it's not a big deal. See?
All I need is a bandage and I'll be good.
I see... I'm so glad.
Thanks for your concern.
...Hey, Itsuka-kun? How do you know me?
Huh? I... don't know.
You knew my name...
Oh, your name? The teacher told me.
I see...

(And thus, our conversation ended. This is so
awkward.)
Uh...

...S-So did you crumb for me because of the
tr-reacher?
You seem to be stumbling, but I don't know why.

S-Sorry. I don't talk to people much... I get so
nervous, I can't speak properly.
You don't like to talk to people?

Yeah... It's very embarrassing.
Especially with you...
Huh? Sorry, I couldn't hear you just now.
No, it's not a big deal. Nevermind.

I-I see. Well, hang in there just a bit longer.
And on a side note, it's not because the
teacher told me to. I just got hurt during P.E.
R-Really?

Yeah. So I'm not here to pull you out or anything.
I've stayed here long enough... Anyways, I'm going
to go now.
O-Okay.

Well... I do feel sad that you're not
coming to class.
Sad...? Why...?

Well, I like spending time in the classroom. If we
were in class together, I'm sure it'd be fun. Sad
isn't the right word... It's unfortunate.

I... I'm not good at talking to people...
so I can't.
But you're talking to me now.
Mm... but...
I'm sure you can do it. Everyone in class is nice.

But I'm very embarrassed right now... My heart is
about to explode. If this is going to happen every
day, I wouldn't be able to stand it.

Then, how about this? I'll visit the infirmary
from time to time. Then maybe you'll get
used to it eventually, no?
Huh...?
Nothing will change if you stay here alone.
Maybe just a little... from time to time.

I see. That's good. Later. I'll come visit
you soon.
Okay... later...
(Origami Tobiichi-san, huh?)
It would be fun to spend some time with her.
